phonegame
Class GameForm

java.lang.Object
  phonegame.GameForm

public final class GameForm
extends java.lang.Object

This class allows you to easily create input forms on which you can add various GUI widgets (textboxes, etc). Please be aware of the fact that you can't control the (exact) position and appearance of the widgets on the form, this is done by the device itself.

Tip: GameForms may come in handy if you want to extend your game with functions that don't fit in your normal gameworld.

Version:
2.0, October 11, 2005, 2.1, April 24, 2006, 3.0, November 17, 2006
Author:
Tim Prijn, Richard Kettelerij & Paul Bergervoet

addBanner

public final void addBanner(java.lang.String text)
Adds a scrolling banner to the form.

Parameters:
text - the text that needs to be displayed

addCheckboxGroup

public final int addCheckboxGroup(java.lang.String label,
                                  java.lang.String[] items)
Adds a number of checkboxes to the form

Parameters:
label - the label displayed above the group
items - the items that should be listed in the checkboxgroup
Returns:
the ID of the newly inserted checkboxgroup. You need this number if you want to retrieve the currently selected items in the checkboxgroup or if you want to delete the checkboxgroup.

                          javax.microedition.lcdui.Image image)
Adds an image to the form.

Parameters:
label - the label displayed next to the image
image - the image that you wnat to display
Returns:
the ID of the newly inserted image. You need this number if you want to delete the textbox.

addLabel

public final int addLabel(java.lang.String label,
                          java.lang.String text)
Adds a label to the form.

Parameters:
label - the labeltext
text - the text value of the label
Returns:
the ID of the newly inserted label. You need this number if you want to retrieve the contents of the label or if you want to delete the label.

addProgressBar

public final int addProgressBar(java.lang.String label,
                                boolean readOnly,
                                int maxValue,
                                int startValue)
Adds a progressbar to the form.

Parameters:
label - the label displayed inside the progessbar
readOnly - true, if you want to create a pure progressbar (that the user can't control). False if you want to create a type of "slidebar" that allows the user to interact with the value of the bar.
maxValue - the maximum value/lenght of the bar
startValue - the initial value of the bar
Returns:
the ID of the newly inserted progressbar. You need this number if you want to retrieve the contents of the progressbar or if you want to delete the progressbar.

addRadioGroup

public final int addRadioGroup(java.lang.String label,
                               java.lang.String[] items)
Adds a number of radiobuttons to the form.

Parameters:
label - the label displayed above the group
items - the items that should be listed in the radiogroup
Returns:
the ID of the newly inserted radiogroup. You need this number if you want to retrieve the currently selected item of the radiogroup or if you want to delete the radiogroup.

addTextBox

public final int addTextBox(java.lang.String label,
                            java.lang.String text,
                            int maxSize)
Adds a textbox to the form.

Parameters:
label - the label in front of the textbox
text - the initial text of the textbox
maxSize - the maximum number of character that is allowed to fit in the textbox
Returns:
the ID of the newly inserted textbox. You need this number if you want to retrieve the contents of the textbox or if you want to delete the textbox.

Parameters:

Throws:
GameException - if the component with the given number was not found

getBannerValue

public final java.lang.String getBannerValue()
                                      throws GameException
Gets the contents of the banner.

Returns:
the text that is currently scrolling in the banner
Throws:
GameException - if there is no banner found on the current form

getCheckboxGroupValue

public final boolean[] getCheckboxGroupValue(int componentNr)
                                      throws GameException
Gets the currently selected items of a certain checkboxgroup on the form.

Parameters:
componentNr - the ID of the checkboxgroup on the form
Returns:
an array of boolean that indicate if a checkbox is either checked (=true) or unchecked (=false).
Throws:
GameException - if the checkboxgroup with the given number is not found

makeMenu

public final void makeMenu(java.lang.String[] menuItems,
                           IMenuListener listener)
                    throws GameException
Create a menu with the given menuitem names.

Parameters:
menuItems - the names that will appear in the phone's menu
listener - reference to an object that can handle menu events
Throws:
GameException - if the one of the two parameters is equal to null

setProgressBarValue

public final void setProgressBarValue(int componentNr,
                                      int value)
                               throws GameException
Sets the value of a certain progressbar on the form.

Parameters:
componentNr - the ID of the progressbar on the form
value - the new value of the progressbar
Throws:
GameException - if the progressbar with the given number is not found

showListbox

public final void showListbox(java.lang.String title,
                              java.lang.String[] items,
                              int selectedItem,
                              java.lang.String[] menuItems,
                              IMenuListener listener)
                       throws GameException
Display a (fullscreen) listbox on the screen.

Note: Unfortunately we cannot place a listbox on a (Game)Form since the listbox is a displayable object on it's own. Therefore this method is called showListbox instead of addListbox.

Parameters:
title - the title of the listbox
items - the items that should be displayed in the listbox
selectedItem - number of an item that is selected by default
menuItems - a list of items that you want to display in the phone menu (or null if you don't want to add a menu)
listener - reference to an object that can handle menu events
Throws:
GameException - if the selectedItem is not found in the items array.

showMessageBox

public final void showMessageBox(java.lang.String title,
                                 java.lang.String message,
                                 javax.microedition.lcdui.AlertType type,
                                 int timeVisible)
Display a messagebox/alert to the user on the screen.

Parameters:
title - the title of the messagebox
message - the message that you want to display
type - the type of messagebox that needs to be displayed, valid values are:

- <u>AlertType.ALARM</u> An ALARM AlertType is a hint to alert the user to an event for which the user has previously requested to be notified.

- <u>AlertType.CONFIRMATION</u> A CONFIRMATION AlertType is a hint to confirm user actions.

- <u>AlertType.ERROR</u> An ERROR AlertType is a hint to alert the user to an erroneous operation.

- <u>AlertType.INFO</u> An INFO AlertType typically provides non-threatening information to the user.

- <u>AlertType.WARNING</u> A WARNING AlertType is a hint to warn the user of a potentially dangerous operation.

timeVisible - the time in milliseconds that you want the messagebox to be visible
